docs.abstract: The former Army analyst had been jailed last year for refusing to testify before a grand jury investigating WikiLeaks and Julian Assange.
docs.snippet: The former Army analyst had been jailed last year for refusing to testify before a grand jury investigating WikiLeaks and Julian Assange.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A federal judge on Thursday ordered the release of Chelsea Manning, the former Army intelligence analyst who in 2010 leaked archives of military and diplomatic documents to WikiLeaks, and who was jailed last year for refusing to testify before a grand jury that is investigating the organization and its founder, Julian Assange.

headline.main: Chelsea Manning Is Ordered Released From Jail
headline.print_headline: Judge Orders Manning to Be Released From Jail One Day After a Suicide Attempt

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

docs.abstract: Facing pressure from parents, conflicting messages from experts and initial silence from the federal government, superintendents began making their own decisions to close.
docs.snippet: Facing pressure from parents, conflicting messages from experts and initial silence from the federal government, superintendents began making their own decisions to close.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention advised schools on Friday that closings for at least eight weeks might be the most effective way to contain the coronavirus. The Education Department released school districts from a slew of testing and accountability measures required by federal law.

headline.main: Administration Offers Guidance to Schools as They Shut Down on Their Own
headline.print_headline: C.D.C. Offers Guidance to Schools as They Shut on Their Own

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

docs.abstract: At Camp 7, the military holds prisoners who were previously held and interrogated by the C.I.A. But in recent years, conditions have eased up a bit.
docs.snippet: At Camp 7, the military holds prisoners who were previously held and interrogated by the C.I.A. But in recent years, conditions have eased up a bit.
docs.lead_paragraph: This article was produced in partnership with the Pulitzer Center on Crisis Reporting.

headline.main: Inside the Most Secret Place at Guantánamo Bay
headline.print_headline: Inside Camp 7: Guantánamo Bay’s Most Clandestine Prisoner Facility

docs.abstract: The president inaccurately described travel restrictions he had announced, falsely blamed his predecessor for testing shortages and misstated the role Google was playing in mitigating the outbreak.
docs.snippet: The president inaccurately described travel restrictions he had announced, falsely blamed his predecessor for testing shortages and misstated the role Google was playing in mitigating the outbreak.
docs.lead_paragraph: As he declared a national emergency over the coronavirus outbreak, President Trump attempted to deflect criticisms of his administration’s response to the virus with inaccurate claims. Here’s a fact-check.

headline.main: Trump’s False Claims About His Response to the Coronavirus

docs.abstract: Attendees of the bash for Kimberly Guilfoyle at the president’s private club chipped in — including financial backers of the Trump re-election campaign.
docs.snippet: Attendees of the bash for Kimberly Guilfoyle at the president’s private club chipped in — including financial backers of the Trump re-election campaign.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — It was a lavish birthday party for Donald Trump Jr.’s girlfriend, Kimberly Guilfoyle. The setting was Mar-a-Lago, President Trump’s private club in Palm Beach, Fla. The guest list included dozens of Trump family members and friends.

headline.main: At Party for Donald Trump Jr.’s Girlfriend, Donors Helped Pick Up the Tab
headline.print_headline: At Party for Trump Jr.’s Girlfriend, Donors Helped Pick Up Tab

byline.original: By Kenneth P. Vogel, Steve Eder and Nicholas Confessore

docs.abstract: The Senate is rushing to complete an economic stabilization package as lawmakers brace for potential travel restrictions.
docs.snippet: The Senate is rushing to complete an economic stabilization package as lawmakers brace for potential travel restrictions.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin rushed to the Capitol on Tuesday to pitch Senate Republicans on a $1 trillion coronavirus relief package, the chamber had already moved into crisis mode as lawmakers confronted a growing sense of urgency to act before much of the nation shuts down.

headline.main: Congress Races to Respond to Pandemic While Defying Ban on Mass Gatherings

byline.original: By Catie Edmondson and Sheryl Gay Stolberg

docs.abstract: Hospital ships stayed in port, veterans hospitals awaited orders and requests for help went unanswered, as much of the government remained on the sidelines.
docs.snippet: Hospital ships stayed in port, veterans hospitals awaited orders and requests for help went unanswered, as much of the government remained on the sidelines.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The mayor of Seattle wanted “mass tents” from the federal government to rapidly build shelters to house people in quarantine. The state of New York pleaded for help from the Army Corps of Engineers to quickly build hospitals. Oregon’s governor repeatedly pressed the Department of Health and Human Services for hundreds of thousands of respirators, gowns and gloves, face shields or goggles.

headline.main: Trump Slowly Enlisting More Agencies in ‘Whole of Government’ Response to Virus

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

byline.original: By Eric Lipton, Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Helene Cooper

docs.abstract: Lawmakers and policy experts say a paid-leave program that passed the House would still discourage some virus-stricken workers from staying home.
docs.snippet: Lawmakers and policy experts say a paid-leave program that passed the House would still discourage some virus-stricken workers from staying home.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In an effort to slow the spread of coronavirus and limit its damage to the economy, congressional leaders and President Trump are stitching together a new safety net for workers who contract the coronavirus or lose their jobs because of it.

headline.main: Congress Is Knitting a Coronavirus Safety Net. It Already Has Big Holes.

byline.original: By Jim Tankersley and Emily Cochrane

docs.abstract: The Trump administration suspended mandated standardized testing and offered loan relief to student borrowers, as the coronavirus shut down education.
docs.snippet: The Trump administration suspended mandated standardized testing and offered loan relief to student borrowers, as the coronavirus shut down education.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Elementary and secondary schools will not be required to do standardized testing, and student borrowers with federal loans can request a reprieve from loan payments while the nation confronts the spreading coronavirus, Education Secretary Betsy DeVos announced on Friday.

headline.main: Relief Offered From Testing and Student Loans as Virus Roils Education

docs.abstract: The 90-day delay will now apply to both tax filings and payments as the United States tries to provide economic relief during the coronavirus outbreak.
docs.snippet: The 90-day delay will now apply to both tax filings and payments as the United States tries to provide economic relief during the coronavirus outbreak.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — American taxpayers will have until July 15 to file their tax returns, Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Friday, a move intended to offer additional reprieve to individuals and companies in the middle of the coronavirus.

headline.main: Trump Administration Delays Tax Day Until July 15
